org.xflatdb.xflat.db

Class TableMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.db.TableMetadata

  • public class TableMetadata
extends java.lang.Object
    A class containing metadata about a Table, and providing the ability to spin up engines for that table. TODO: this class really performs two responsibilities, one is managing the spin-up and spin-down of the engine for the table, the other is creating TableBase instances. The two responsibilities should be separated. You can see where the line is inside the TableMetadataFactory class.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • canSpinDown

        public boolean canSpinDown()
        Called to determine whether the table has been inactive long enough that it can be spun down.
        Returns:
        true if the engine is inactive and has no uncommitted data.

      • getEngine

        public EngineBase getEngine()

      • getTable

        public TableBase getTable(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)

      • provideEngine

        public EngineBase provideEngine()

      • spinDown

        public EngineBase spinDown(boolean ignoreUncommitted,
                  boolean force)
        Spins down the engine, leaving the metadata in a state where it will be required to spin up a new engine before providing it.
        Parameters:
        ignoreUncommitted - Whether to require a spin down even if the engine has uncommitted data, effectively automatically reverting it. Usually only set when the entire database is being shut down.
        force - whether to use forceSpinDown instead of a natural spin down.
        Returns:
        The engine that was spun down.
